alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 08 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A DAM RELEASE REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by upstream dam release continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Arizona, including the following county, Maricopa. * WHEN...Until 745 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of unbridged crossings across the Salt River upstream of Tempe Town Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 559 AM MST, upstream releases from Stewart Mountain Dam Granite Reef Dam are resulting in elevated flow in the Salt River between Granite Reef Dam and Tempe Town Lake. These releases will impact low water crossings between Granite Reef Dam and Tempe Town Lake, with existing road closures. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Salt River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Unbridged river crossings such as McKellips and Gilbert Roads, and gravel pit operations along the Salt River between Granite Reef Dam and Tempe Town Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
